<center>

## **Shapiro-Wilk normality test**

</center>

<br>
<center>

The $Shapiro$ â€“ $Wilk$ test is used to test if the sample follows a $normal$ distribution.
</center>

<br>
<center>
$$W = \frac{\left ( \sum_{i=1}^{n} a_{i}x_{\left(i\right)}  \right)^2}{\sum_{i=1}^{n} \left( x_{i}-\bar{x}\right)^2}$$

</center
<br>
<center>

where $x_{\left(i\right)}$ follows the $i$ th order statistic and $a$ represents a coefficient (whose calculation details fall beyond the purpose of this short introduction).


</center>


<br>
<center>
*Hypothesis*:
<br>
$H_{0}:population$ $is$ $normally$ $distributed$
<br>
$H_{1}:population$ $is$ $not$ $normally$ $distributed$
</center>
